snippet: J. Dennis Hastert, the former speaker of the House of Representatives, is scheduled to make his first court appearance Thursday on charges linked to allegations that he agreed to pay $3.5 million in hush money.
abstract: Former Republican House Speaker J Dennis Hastert is set to make his first court appearance linked to allegations that he agreed to pay $3.5 million to keep an unidentified person silent about misconduct; Hastert has been charged only with evading bank regulations and lying to the Federal Bureau of Investigation about bank withdrawals in connection with the allegations.
lead_paragraph: J. Dennis Hastert, the former speaker of the House of Representatives, is scheduled to make his first court appearance Thursday on charges linked to allegations that he agreed to pay $3.5 million in hush money.

headline.main: Illinois: Hastert Set to Appear in Court on Thursday
headline.print_headline: Illinois: Hastert Set to Appear in Court on Thursday
